comments:
I'm not sure if this is a GUI threading problem, or if this is a refresh
problem...  I have a medium sized project (approx 5000 files, including .jar and
a few other binaries) that for some reason keeps "locking up" the GUI during a
"refresh."  I can go into each of the folders within the project and "refresh"
with no errors, but if I try to "refresh" the entire project, I have the
following symptoms:  Progress shows recompilation of the entire project, then
during the "in progress..." portion (approx. 60% of the way through), the GUI
stops functioning and will not repaint, the CPU goes to 100% utilization, and a
ps -ef shows about 10 threads tied to Eclipse.  Two of the threads (I am
assuming the main thread and a gui thread) each vie for approx 50% cpu
utilization.  The only way to stop it is to kill the GUI or the main thread
associated with Eclipse.  The log file shows the following paste:
